select1.label: After bandaging hand, take 3 turns upwards from wrist , carrying the bandage up the limb as a simple spiral , so that one third of previous turn is exposed . on reaching the more muscular part of forearm it will be found that simple spiral turns no longer lie evenly on limb, the lower border becoming loose . To obviate this , it's necessary to make ascending revere spiral

To do this , support forearm with finger of free hand , carry the bandage across the back of fore arm , keeping its head inclined upwards so that the bandage lies flat on the skin , whilst its in this position , place the thumb of the hand supporting the limb on the folds over the thumb , making a reverse . carry the bandage again round the limb and repeat the reverse and continue up the forearm towards the elbow , each turn exposing one thoirs of the breadth of previously applied arm
